summary.para: Adds blocks of audio data to the currently open track. This method can be called repeatedly until there is no space available or the track is full.

param.name: pby
param.para: Pointer to an array of track blocks. The format is 44.1 KHz 16-bit stereo RAW audio samples, in the same format as used by WAV in the data section.

param.name: cb
param.para: Size of the array, in bytes. This count must be a multiple of the audio block size.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

remarks.para: After all blocks are added, call the method to finish the track.

If a call to this method would overrun the number of available audio blocks, then the method will return IMAPI_E_DISCFULL and keep as much of the audio data as it can. In contrast, the method does not keep any of the data, so there are no bad files.

summary.para: Closes a currently open audio track. All audio tracks must be closed before the method can be called.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Begins staging a new audio track. It can be called only when there are no open audio tracks in the image.

param.name: nBlocks
param.para: Number of audio blocks to be added to this track. You can create up to 99 tracks, and the open track may consume all remaining available audio blocks.
The nBlocks parameter is advisory only. It does not force the track length to this size.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

remarks.para: After the track is open, use the method to add data to the track.

summary.para: Retrieves the size, in bytes, of an audio block.

param.name: pnBlockBytes
param.para: Total size, in bytes, of a single audio block.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Retrieves the current number of blocks that can be added to the track before an additional add will cause a failure for lack of space.

param.name: pnBlocks
param.para: Number of audio blocks that can be added to the open track before it must be closed.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

remarks.para: This method accounts for gaps associated with open tracks. Additionally, if this method is called when there is no open track, it returns the maximum number of audio blocks that could be added if a new track is created (accounting for gaps, and so on).

summary.para: Retrieves the total number of blocks available for staging audio tracks. The total includes all block types, including blocks that may need to be allocated for track gaps.

param.name: pnBlocks
param.para: Total number of audio blocks available on a disc.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Retrieves the total number of tracks that have either been staged or are being staged.

param.name: pnTracks
param.para: Total number of closed and open tracks.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Retrieves the total number of audio blocks in use.

param.name: pnBlocks
param.para: Total number of blocks in use, in both closed and open tracks.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: The IRedbookDiscMaster interface enables the staging of an audio CD image. It represents one of the formats supported by MSDiscMasterObj, and it allows the creation of multi-track audio discs in Track-at-Once mode (fixed-size audio gaps).

Tracks are created in the stash file, data is added to them, and then they are closed. Only one track is staged at a time; this is called the open track. The remaining tracks are closed and committed to the image, while the open track has available to it all the blocks that are not in use by closed tracks.
